feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Continue on the Tanana River... The Tanana River continues to run near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to fall slowly over the next couple of days, but additional heavy rainfall in the central and eastern Interior, and Alaska Range through Monday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Heavy Rain in the Alaska Range... Another moisture laden weather system will move across the Interior and Alaska Range tonight and Sunday with rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 2.0 inches. Additional rainfall is expected through mid week with 1 to 2 inches Tuesday into Wednesday. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued July 16 at 2:42PM AKDT until July 17 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Through passes in the Eastern Alaska Range. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:07PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Widespread rain is expected to continue across Southcentral Alaska through the end of the weekend as a series of storm systems move across the region. The first storm system moved through overnight and this morning bringing heavy rain to the area with the greatest amounts seen across the Western Susitna Valley, where over 2.5" has already fallen. A second storm system is then expected to bring another round of moderate to heavy rain across the western Kenai Peninsula,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 15 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH SUNDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Sunday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone
entry.cap:areaDesc: Pinal

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:28AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY FOG THIS MORNING... Surface observations and satellite imagery indicate that patchy fog, perhaps locally dense, has developed across Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Kenedy, and northern Hidalgo Counties. entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS: Low Humidities...Hot Temperatures...and Strong Gusty
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Wind River Mountains, South Shoshone NF; Upper Wind River Basin, Wind River Basin

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 17 at 2:11AM MDT until July 17 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Temperatures 99 to 104 expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana. Portions of north central Wyoming. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 10 PM MDT this evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sheridan Foothills
